clues.text: Arhus, Denmark's second-largest city, lies on this peninsula

During the Civil War, General Sherman reduced this state capital to ashes, causing it to be called "Chimneyville"
Until the '60s, French was the official language of this British island in the English Channel
The names of a period of the Mesozoic Era & a Spielberg thriller both come from this 4-letter Alpine range

Not popular with criminals:
DEA

A big part of the paper chase:
GPO

A source of future pilots:
AFROTC
clues.response: the Air Force Reserve Officer Training Corps

clues.text:
They build bridges to the future:
ACE

Sort of like the Peace Corps, only local:
VISTA

rounds.comments: (Alex: Let's see if you remember that event!)

clues.text: There were an average of 2.67 of these a game, not enough for some bored U.S. viewers

Resembling trolls, trows live in these Scottish islands famous for their small ponies
Of all Shakespeare's plays, this one has the most fairies

Type of hit that won Frank Baker his nickname when he hit 2 in the 1911 World Series
Trumpet-playing Baker seen here

In the 2nd century, this Greek showed that arteries carry blood, not air as had been thought

rounds.text: Though Rhea was his mother, in one tradition this god was brought up by Capheira, the daughter of Oceanus
